main.name: Irfan Irawan Sukirman, S.Kom
main.jobDescription: mobile engineer of our product using kotlin for android native and hybrid using flutter framework
main.bio: Enthusias about native android using kotlin and hybrid using flutter. Hard worker independently or in team. My hobbies are cycling and tasting food.
main.contactmessage: Have a project for me? Think I'd be a good fit for your team? I'd love to hear from you, give me a shout by email or by using the form below if you'd like to get in contact with me.

address.street: Jln. Mohammad Toha Gang Aki Ahman No. 111/203D RT 007 RW 005 Kel. Ciseureuh Kec. Regol

resume.skillmessage: I'm a tinkerer and am always interested in playing around with new technologies but these are the ones that have really won me over

education.degree: Bachelors in Computer Science, Software Engineering Option
education.description: Under the recommendation and Guidance of the Head Coach of the UVIC soccer team, I transferred to the University of Victoria. Here I took my Bachelors of Computer Science with a Software Engineering Specialty and achieved a much more thorough education in the underlying theory, concepts, and science behind more complex programming. It was here that I discovered my passion for scalable application programming (web and mobile), the security behind computer and application systems, and found that I have a knack for understanding complex algorithms.

I attended GPRC for my first 2 years of post-secondary on a scholarship for the college soccer team. While here, I studied Computer Systems Technology, a 2 year lead-in to a Bachelors of Computer Science. This was a very hands-on experience focused more on building projects than general theory. Here I built database structures for fictional companies, created small video games, hand-coded Space Invaders from scratch in Assembly Language, built and coded an Arduino Robot to navigate obstacle courses, a lot of Java and C++ programming for data structures, and much more.

skills.name: Git
skills.description: I use Git for all of my projects so far. I have used Git for version control in small teams and have toyed around with contributing to Open Source Projects.

skills.name: Java
skills.description: Java was my first programming language that I started using in college years ago. It is by far the language I am most familiar with in terms of data-structure and algorithm programming.

skills.name: Kotlin
skills.description: Kotlin is the second language after java that I use for android application development. When I first started using this language it felt very good. Makes code much more concise and easier to read.

skills.name: Flutter
skills.description: Flutter is an open-source UI software development kit created by Google. I using it to develop applications for Android, iOS, and the web from a single codebase. I think Flutter will be a promising tool in the future.

skills.name: SQL Lite
skills.description: SqlLite is a tool that mostly I use to store local databases on android applications that I create. I currently use the room to make it easier to use SqLite on Android.

skills.name: AdonisJS
skills.description: AdonisJS is a framework that can use for making REST API project. I use it to make small projects. After trying it, it's not that difficult and fast to learn, especially those who want to be able to have skills as a backend developer.

skills.name: MySQL
skills.description: I use it for storing data from backend services. MySQL is one of my most favorite database management systems.

skills.name: XML
skills.description: XML is one of my most favorite language bacause it's easy to use and on android i use for build UI, manifest configuration, style, theme, and many more.
